discussion.content:
I am agree with LucLJ : the question is not clear. But C is the only possible answer. 
For C is ok, it must a manual check (like check) and you do not have send it to your supplier. If it is a electronic payment, it could be complexe to cancel the payment sent to your bank
C. yes, by voiding the payment created
Question not clear. If the bank has executed the payment, just voiding the payment is NOT the solution.

questions.question_text: If you accidentally paid an invoice using Create Payment flow, can you undo the operation?

choices.C: yes, by voiding the payment created
choices.D: yes, by creating a credit memo to offset the payment
choices.B: Cancel the invoice and create a new one.
choices.A: yes, by canceling the payment process from the process monitor

discussion.content:
https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/fusion-apps/paycash-e22897-02-1514523.pdf

Why didn’t an installment get selected for payment?
An installment can meet the selection criteria of a payment process request, yet
not get selected for payment for one or more reasons.
You can review installments that were not selected for payment, along with
the reasons they were not selected, on the Not Selected tab of the Review
Installments page.
The reasons are as follows:
• Rejected by approver
• Withholding tax calculation error
• Credit reduces payment amount below zero
• Invoice needs revalidation
• Invoice requires approval
• Invoice never validated
• Payment date in closed period
• Payment date before system date not allowed
• Installment on hold
• Supplier site on payment hold
• Installment manually removed
• Zero amount installments excluded

C. The invoice requires approval.
E. The invoice needs re-validation.

choices.B: The invoice has not been accounted.
choices.D: The pay-through date is in a future period.
choices.A: The pay-through date is in a closed Payables period.

questions.question_text:
An installment meets all the selection criteria of a Payment Process Request, but it still does not get selected for payment processing.
What are the two possible reasons for this?
